title: FAA says Verizon and AT&T can continue rolling out C-Band 5G near airports
content:
Verizon and AT&T started rolling out 5G on C-Band spectrum in the United States last week, finally giving both carriers an answer to the success of T-Mobile’s mid-band 5G. The rollout was delayed due to concerns from the Federal Aviation Administration (FAA) and some airlines, because it could interfere with equipment in some airplanes and

The post FAA says Verizon and AT&T can continue rolling out C-Band 5G near airports appeared first on xda-developers.
description: The FAA is continuing to check airports off the list for possible C-Band interference, paving the way for more C-Band 5G coverage.
